intro: Heteropterys appendiculata, commonly known as the appendiculate bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are usually ovate or elliptical with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Heteropterys appendiculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
